title.narrative: CHILDREN AND CAREGIVERS HAVE INCREASED CAPACITIES TO PREVENT AND RESPOND TO VAC

description.narrative: Output 3.3: Children, adolescents, caregivers, communities and service providers have increased capacity to prevent, recognize, and respond to violence against children

mailing-address.narrative: Lhaki Lham 1-11 P.O. Box 239 Thimphu Bhutan

sector.narrative: Access to child-friendly police and justice sector services
Capacity and skills development for social behaviour change
Child protection focused on care and support for children with disabilities
Relief co-ordination, protection and support services
Services to prevent or respond to violence, exploitation and abuse
System strengthening for adolescent participation and civic engagement (including in humanitarian settings)

title.narrative: Bhutan United Nations Development Assistance Framework 2014-2018
United Nations Sustainable Development Partnership Framework for Bhutan 2019-2023

UNICEF Programmes in Bhutan (Communication for Development)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 3.3: Children, adolescents, caregivers, communities and service providers have increased capacity to prevent, recognize, and respond to violence against children

description.narrative: Through UNICEF support, children, adolescents, parents and caregivers have been reached through the partnership with the Scout Division under the Ministry of Education who were supported with training on how to prevent and respond to violence, abuse and exploitation of children especially during the current COVID-19 pandemic. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:28/08/2020

title.narrative: Number of children and adolescents supported by UNICEF programmes who have knowledge about how/where to report violence against children
Number of mothers, fathers and caregivers reached through parenting programmes
